alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 3:19PM EDT until June 16 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTY... At 317 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Canadohta Lake, moving east at 45 mph. The earlier line of storms has broken into multiple thunderstorms. This storm is the strongest of them which will move into Warren County. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Youngsville, Russell, Spring Creek, Lottsville, Enterprise, Garland, Grand Valley, Sugar Grove, Starbrick and Bear Lake. This includes the following highways... Route 6 from Columbus to Starbrick. Route 62 between south of Irvine and Starbrick...and from Warren to the New York border. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for north central Pennsylvania. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
